oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York story -- Conrad Pile's first home

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Caves; Cave dwellings

Ganier, Albert Franklin, 1883-1973; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Fentress County (Tenn.); Pile, Conrad, 1766-1849; Lasky, Jesse L., 1880-1958; Lasky, Jesse L., 1910-1988; Cave dwellings; United States; Caves -- Tennessee -- Fentress County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three men stand inside a cave; a dilapidated wooden pen can be seen in front of the cave opening. Two of the men appear to be producer Jesse Lasky and his son. The third man, whose identity is not given, appears to be wearing a hat.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jesse L. Lasky was the producer of the film "Sergeant York," which won two Oscars in 1941. Conrad "Old Coonrod" Pile (1766-1849), a great-great-grandfather of York, arrived in the upper Wolf River area around 1800.
